name: places/ChIJ6V9SGGb2wokR27jCWKaoHBY
adrFormatAddress: 3357 Broadway, New York, NY 10031-7402, USA

originalText.text: This laundromat is always dirty. Half of the time when you open a washing machine to put your clothes in, the machine smells so musty & just awful inside. I can't believe this place had the audacity to raise the prices on their machines. I understand inflation is high but this place is just dirty. Look at the inside of the sink, it didn't get like that after one day. You can just tell it's always dirty there. The older woman that works at this laundromat is super rude. If I could give 0 stars, I definitely would.

If I could give 0 stars, I definitely would.

originalText.text: No space and always packed, can’t move. If you leave your laundry for more than a minute when it’s done it is taken out of the machine. Got quarters and the machine ate my money and I was asked if I was sure if I put a $20 into the machine for quarters.

text.text: No space and always packed, can’t move. If you leave your laundry for more than a minute when it’s done it is taken out of the machine. Got quarters and the machine ate my money and I was asked if I was sure if I put a $20 into the machine for quarters.

originalText.text: Laundry attendants are very rude. After mentioning my child's clothes were not drying after over 30mins they began arguing and telling me I should use 5-6 quarters.  The attendant also forced me to give up my laundry basket to another customer as if I was not a paying customer as well. I would go to Brooklyn to do my laundry before I come back to this place. Horrible service.

text.text: Laundry attendants are very rude. After mentioning my child's clothes were not drying after over 30mins they began arguing and telling me I should use 5-6 quarters.  The attendant also forced me to give up my laundry basket to another customer as if I was not a paying customer as well. I would go to Brooklyn to do my laundry before I come back to this place. Horrible service.

originalText.text: The washing machine in my house died and I had to buy new washing machine, while I shopped around for a new appliance and waited for it to get delivered (which was a two month process) I had little choice but to take my laundry here. The three times I utilized their drop off service was worse and worse each time... Each of the three batches had missing socks (as if I wasn't going to notice!) And one of my t-shirts went missing. Either they have a sock and tshirt theft ring going on in here or they're too inept to do a job as simple as washing clothes, I'm not sure. The attendants are very rude and constantly kept asking me if I had any blankets in my laundry sack cause if I did it'll be $5 more or something..They're so concerned of squeezing every dollar out of a customer but when you confront them about missing clothes they act like they don't know. Bunch of thieves. This place should be placed under new administration and staff. If I could leave 0 stars I would!

Either they have a sock and tshirt theft ring going on in here or they're too inept to do a job as simple as washing clothes, I'm not sure. The attendants are very rude and constantly kept asking me if I had any blankets in my laundry sack cause if I did it'll be $5 more or something..They're so concerned of squeezing every dollar out of a customer but when you confront them about missing clothes they act like they don't know. Bunch of thieves. This place should be placed under new administration and staff. If I could leave 0 stars I would!

originalText.text:
I am ashamed to say that I had never taken my clothes to wash at a public laundry facility. I came here on my last night in New York so that I could fly home with clean laundry. I had no expectations coming to the facility except to leave with clean, dry clothes. My visit was on a Saturday at the magical hour of 12 a.m. There were several other people who came in during that time, and there was also an attendant available to answer questions or assist if needed. The attendant was super friendly, and answered all of the moronic questions that I had about doing laundry in a public facility. I was surprised to learn that the laundry facility offers a service for laundering clothes, blanket/sheets, etc.
I struck up a conversation with a gentleman who had taken a binder filled with his lovely artwork and he allowed me to browse through his work. Perhaps if I had gone during a busier hour I would have had a different experience; however, washing my clothes at this facility in Harlem was both a unique and a positive experience.

I had no expectations coming to the facility except to leave with clean, dry clothes. My visit was on a Saturday at the magical hour of 12 a.m. There were several other people who came in during that time, and there was also an attendant available to answer questions or assist if needed. The attendant was super friendly, and answered all of the moronic questions that I had about doing laundry in a public facility. I was surprised to learn that the laundry facility offers a service for laundering clothes, blanket/sheets, etc.
I struck up a conversation with a gentleman who had taken a binder filled with his lovely artwork and he allowed me to browse through his work. Perhaps if I had gone during a busier hour I would have had a different experience; however, washing my clothes at this facility in Harlem was both a unique and a positive experience.
